definition: Epiphany
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
to make visible/to reveal/prominent/conspicuous/(prefix) phanero-
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Don't tell me you've had a religious epiphany.
sentences.chinese: 不要告诉我你是个刚过了个主显节。

sentences.english: DB: At home are you of those who celebrate Papá Noel or Los Reyes Magos?
sentences.chinese: 在家里你们是过圣诞节还是主显节呢？
